The Monkey and
 the Crocodile
 
 Mozambican folktale
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 A monkey lived in a big tre 
 
 on the bank of a river. In 
 
 the midle of the river there 
 
 was a smal island. Lots of 
 
 fruit tres grew on that 
 
 island. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The monkey wanted to go 
 
 and eat the fruit. He saw a 
 
 big rock half way acros 
 
 the river and he thought he 
 
 could jump onto the rock, 
 
 and then onto the island. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 He jumped into the air and 
 
 landed on the rock. He 
 
 jumped again and reached 
 
 the island. He enjoyed 
 
 eating the fruit and then 
 
 went back home. He did 
 
 this several times. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But a crocodile lived in the 
 
 river with his wife! The wife 
 
 said, "Dear husband, you 
 
 should go and lie on the 
 
 rock. The colour of your 
 
 skin matches the colour of 
 
 the rock." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 A few days later, the 
 
 crocodile saw the monkey 
 
 coming onto the island. He 
 
 quietly climbed over the 
 
 rock and carefuly lay down 
 
 on it and kept his face 
 
 underwater. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The monkey finished eating 
 
 and was ready to go back. 
 
 But the rock loked higher 
 
 than usual, so he spoke to 
 
 the rock, "Dear rock, you 
 
 sem to have grown. Are 
 
 you al right?" 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The crocodile was a fol 
 
 and thought the rock must 
 
 be a talking rock. So he 
 
 answered the monkey and 
 
 said, "I lok biger because 
 
 a big crocodile is lying on 
 
 me". 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The monkey said, "Dear 
 
 crocodile, I know you want 
 
 to eat me. I am very old 
 
 and you can have my body. 
 
 But I must say godbye to 
 
 my children in that big 
 
 tre." So the crocodile gave 
 
 him a ride on his back! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As son as they were there, 
 
 the monkey climbed the 
 
 tre and said, “Thank you 
 
 for the ride, my dear friend. 
 
 Godbye, now you can go 
 
 home!" But the crocodile 
 
 said, "But you promised…." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The monkey laughed and 
 
 said, "What a fol you were 
 
 to believe me!" and 
 
 disapeared behind the 
 
 branches of the tre. The 
 
 crocodile never did catch 
 
 that clever monkey!
